awd_titl_txt: Plant Cell Culture Process Development for Production of    Trichosanthin
awd_abstract_narration: This study will evaluate the feasibility of a plant cell                        culture process to produce a protein product.  The system                       which will be studied is the production of a protein,                           trichosanthin, from plant cell cultures of Trichosanthes                        cucumerina and Trichosanthes kirilowii.  Trichosanthin is                       a fairly well characterized protein that has been                               reported in the literature and may have significant value                       as a human therapeutic agent.  In addition to improving                         the understanding of the important engineering aspects of                       plant cell cultures, the development of plant cell                              culture process technology for trichosanthin may lead the                       way for development of processes for production of other                        ribosome inactivating proteins.
org_div_long_name: Division of Chemical, Bioengineering, Environmental, and Transport Systems

pgm_ref.pgm_ref_txt: REU SUPP-Res Exp for Ugrd Supp
